alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 2:51AM CST until February 16 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions expected late this morning through the afternoon over portions of the Rio Grande, Winter Garden, and southern Edwards Plateau.. A cold front has moved across the area this morning, with gusty northerly wind behind it. Expect north winds from 15 to 20 mph, with gusts to 40 mph today. Dry to critically dry fuels in combination with minimum humidity in the teens and gusty wind, will create critical fire weather conditions. People in these regions should avoid any activities that could inadvertently lead to the ignition and spread of wildfires during this time. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE, THE WINTER GARDEN, AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 4 PM CST this afternoon. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...North wind 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
